definition: the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: Abide with me fast falls the eventide;
sentences.chinese: 夕陽西沉，求主與我同住。

sentences.english: To follow knowledge like a sinking star.
sentences.chinese: 去追隨知識，像那西沉的星星。

sentences.english: Watching the sun go down is a nice little sunset date .
sentences.chinese: 在傍晚看落日西沉是一個不錯的方式。

sentences.english: At 3800 meter elevation, the sun sinking, what was I thinking?
sentences.chinese: 在海拔3800米的山頂，夕陽西沉，我在想什麼。

sentences.english: Watching the sun go down is a nice little sunset date.
sentences.chinese: 在傍晚看落日西沉是不錯的。

sentences.english: The sun is setting, soon the stars will shine upon me.
sentences.chinese: 太陽西沉，星星很快將照耀我。

sentences.english: Her shadow lengthened as the sun set.
sentences.chinese: 他的影子隨着太陽西沉而逐漸拉長。

sentences.english: The sun was sinking low in the west， the sky was of gold.
The sun is setting, but the action is just beginning.
sentences.chinese: 太陽西沉，但活動纔剛剛開始。

sentences.english: The sun set; the dusk fell on the stream, and lights began to appear along the shore.
sentences.chinese: 太陽西沉，黃昏降臨河上，岸上出現了一排燈光。

sentences.english: The sun dipped below the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 太陽西沉到地平線以下。

sentences.english: The sun was sinking fast and the peasants had all left the church area.
sentences.chinese: 太陽西沉，農民們都已經離開了教堂。

sentences.english: When the blazing sun is gone, when he nothing shines upon.
sentences.chinese: 當熾熱的太陽已經西沉，當他不再普照萬物了。

definition: the sun sets in the west (idiom)
the sun sets over western hills (idiom); the day approaches its end/fig. time of decline/the end of an era/Sic transit gloria mundi
variant of 餘暉|余晖[yu2 hui1]
color of the sky/time of day, as indicated by the color of the sky/weather
white (paint from dried fish guts)/marble white color of the dawn sky
